Package lawnlayer

Class TileList

  • java.lang.Object
    • lawnlayer.TileList
  • public class TileList
extends java.lang.Object
    A class acting as a container for the Tile objects. Its data structure and behaviours are essentially a combination of a List and a Set: an ordered collection of unique objects that supports random access and indexing. In addition, this class provides methods to perform game mechanics on these tiles such such as filling regions, propagating red paths, removing collided tiles, etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Initialises an empty TileList with no specified name nor sprite of the tiles to be contained inside it.

      TileList​(processing.core.PImage tileSprite, Info.Name tileName)
      Initialises an empty TileList with the specified tileSprite and tileName of the tiles to be contained inside it.

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll​(TileList otherTiles)
        Adds all of the tiles inside the specified otherTiles into this TileList. For each tile, if it already exists in this TileList, skips and does not add it.
        Parameters:

      • fill

        public void fill​(TileList borderTiles,
                 TileList unfilledTiles,
                 TileList fillTiles,
                 TileList concreteTiles,
                 java.util.List<Enemy> enemies,
                 boolean printMsg)
        Fills the regions enclosed on two sides of this TileList, if there are no enemies within them.

        Retrieves the starting tiles for the first and second region respectively. Then, fills the first and second region into two TileLists. For each region, checks if there are enemies within it, and clears the corresponding TileList if there is at least one. Finally, updates the grass fill tiles by adding in the region TileLists, and updates the unfilled tiles by removing tiles that are contained in the region TileLists.

        Parameters:
        borderTiles - the TileList of grass border tiles
        unfilledTiles - the TileList of unfilled tiles
        fillTiles - the TileList of grass fill tiles
        concreteTiles - the TileList of concrete tiles
        enemies - the List of enemies
        printMsg - toggles fill messages printed in the terminal
        See Also:
        convertToFillTiles(TileList), getStartTiles(TileList, TileList), fillRegion(Tile, TileList, TileList, PImage), Entity.isOverlapping(GameObject)

      • propagate

        public void propagate​(processing.core.PImage redPathSprite,
                      int frameCount)
        Propagates red path as per the pre-defined FPP (frames per propagation).

        Loops through this TileList and locates the red path tile. If a red path is found and n frames has passed since the last propagation (where n is the FPP), retrieves its adjacent path tiles and turn them red.

        Parameters:
        redPathSprite - the PImage sprite of the red path
        frameCount - the current frame
        See Also:
        Tile.getAdjacentTiles(), Tile.isRed(), Tile.turnRed(PImage, int)

      • removeFloatingTiles

        public void removeFloatingTiles​(TileList otherTiles)
        Removes any floating tiles in this TileList.

        A tile is removed if it is floating around this TileList and the specified otherTiles.

        Parameters:
        otherTiles - the TileList of tiles to be checked against for floating tiles
        See Also:
        Collection.removeIf(java.util.function.Predicate), Tile.isFloatingAround(TileList)

      • updateBorder

        public void updateBorder​(Tile collidedTile,
                         TileList fillTiles)
        Updates the border tiles contained in this TileList whenever a tile has been collided by an Enemy of type Beetle.

        Loops through the specified fillTiles and locates the tile(s) that are adjacent to the specified collidedTile. Marks those tile(s) for removal from fillTiles and and adds them to this TileList, turning them into new border tiles. Finally, removes the collidedTile from this TileList.

        Parameters:
        collidedTile - the border tile which has been collided
        fillTiles - the TileList of grass fill tiles
        See Also:
        Tile.isAdjacentTo(Tile)
